name: Reddit Reborn
description:
Reddit Reborn is my attempt to reimagine the reddit UI - it's an extremely comprehensive skin which aims to improve readability and aesthetics across the website.  It started off as a personal project but I have spent my last few weeks of spare time preparing it for distribution.  I have tried to improve it, fix some ugly hacks and broken pages, as well as adapt it to work on more browsers.  I hope that it should now work for most users of modern Gecko/webkit browers but cannot yet offer any guarantees.

Important: in order for this style to work, you *must* disable custom CSS by logging in, going to preferences and unticking "allow reddits to show me custom styles".  If you fail to do this, certain subreddits may become unreadable.
additional_info:
Suggestions: this style can be used as a userscript, but the page will flash up unthemed for a coupled of seconds before changing - stylish is required for a seamless experience.  Note that the extension is fairly broken in Chrome 9+, but works well enough to install and load styles (any management effectively requires reinstalling the extension and styles).

If you use the Reddit Enhancement Suite, please consider style 44719 instead.

Any constructive criticism is much appreciated; this style has taken me a long time to develop and it's quite possible I've lost sight of some glaring issues along the way.

I am a student and sadly have quite limited time - however I will try to respond to most comments and implement any interesting suggestions.  Any donations would be much appreciated but are not expected or required.  I will certainly make it a priority to add features and options suggested by donors, but my primary concern in developing this style has been to give something back to the great reddit comunity.

Changelog

Version 1.2:-
  User page tweaks (remove out of place border, improve padding)
  Text size changes
  Comment gradient changes
  Padding changes
  Improved navigation buttons
  Improved comment expand/collapse buttons
  Improve tabs
  Fixed bug in visited link states


Version 1.1:-
  style 44719 added, improvements to inbox appearance and Chrome compatability.

Version 1.0 :-
  Initial release.
  Only extensively tested with Firefox 4 betas, should also work with trunk versions of Mozilla/Camino and recent webkit browsers.

discussions.name: Any way we can add this rule for /r/pics (or similar)?
Love this style! Thank you so much! Made a donate!~
